--- "Rakesh" <rakeshm@i...> wrote:
> I am sorry, I used "Recursive" in place of "Repetitive".
> I want [...]
>         while(true) {
>             // execute the test cases.
>         }

Consider 'junit.extensions.RepeatedTest' -- which will run a set of 
tests some fixed number of times.

Or you could customize a test runner to automatically restart after 
every successful run.

Or maybe what you need is Cruise Control.  It's an open source tool 
that continuously goes through a loop of fetching your source code, 
building the system, and running the tests.  Over and over again, non-
stop, forever.  (It emails the people who most recently checked in 
changes if any of the tests fail.)

http://cruisecontrol.sourceforge.net/
